articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel targeted a Gaza school on Thursday that it said contained an Hamas compound, killing fighters involved in the Oct. 7 attack that sparked the eight-month war, but Gaza media said the strike killed at least 27 people seeking shelter.
articles.title: Israel says jets strike school containing Hamas compound, Gaza media says 27 killed

articles.author: Jack Queen, Tom Hals
articles.description: Hunter Biden's sister-in-law testified on Thursday that she took and threw away his gun out of fear of his spiraling addiction, potentially bolstering prosecutors' case that President Joe Biden's son broke a law barring illegal drug users from owning firearms.
articles.title: Hunter Biden's sister-in-law describes finding crack, gun in his truck

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, John Irish, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: Veterans and world leaders meet in Normandy on Thursday to mark the 80th anniversary of the June 6, 1944 D-Day landings, when more than 150,000 Allied soldiers arrived in France by sea and air to drive out the forces of Nazi Germany.
articles.title: World leaders, veterans, commemorate D-Day's 80th anniversary in Normandy

articles.author: Kopano Gumbi, Nellie Peyton
articles.description: South Africa's African National Congress will invite other political parties to form a national unity government, its leader President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Thursday, after it lost its majority for the first time in the democratic era.
articles.title: South Africa's ANC will seek to form government of national unity

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: Voting began in the Netherlands on Thursday at the start of a four-day election across the European Union to a new European Parliament that will face mounting security, industrial and political challenges.
articles.title: Netherlands kicks off four-day European Parliament election

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that Western nations which supply Ukraine with weapons to directly strike Russian territory will definitely face consequences after President Vladimir Putin said he was considering arming the West's enemies in retaliation.
articles.title: Kremlin says Kyiv's backers will face consequences after Putin says he may arm West's enemies

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Arshad Mohammed, John Irish
articles.description: Three European powers have written to the U.N. Security Council detailing Iran's violations of its 2015 nuclear deal, a step diplomats said on Thursday aimed to pressure Tehran to resolve the issue diplomatically and to avoid reimposing U.N. sanctions.
articles.title: Europeans detail Iran's nuclear violations in diplomatic gambit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France plans to provide Mirage 2000 warplanes to Ukraine, President Emmanuel Macron told French TV stations on Thursday.
articles.title: France to provide Mirage 2000 warplanes to Ukraine, Macron says

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: SpaceX's Starship rocket survived a fiery, hypersonic return from space and achieved a breakthrough landing demonstration in the Indian Ocean on Thursday, completing a full test mission around the globe on the rocket's fourth try.
articles.title: SpaceX's Starship survives return to Earth, aces landing test on fourth try

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu
articles.description: Fires in Brazil's Pantanal wetlands have surged nearly tenfold so far this year to the highest levels since 2020, when the biome suffered its worst blazes on record.
articles.title: Fires in Brazilian wetlands surge 980%, extreme drought expected
